title.narrative: F.a: Quality Assurance and Risk Management

description.narrative: All organisations involved in international development face growing demands of value for money, as well as significant expectations regarding the quality assurance and results of their work. A proper results-based management (RBM) system cannot be built o n one-off interventions, or processes targeting the quality of the programme from a narrow perspective. It entails a set of well-integrated purposeful functions, which respond to the specific requirements of the programme and the challenges posed by comple x environments. CMI strives to further develop its RBM systems to better respond to complexity through applying a non-linear approach to monitoring and evaluating results. The development of CMIs RBM and learning systems is done in closely collaboration wi th broader group of Finnish and international actors and include testing of innovative use of technology for peace related to work in complex settings. ##Successful utilisation of CMIs RBM system requires functioning and real-time feedback loops between pr oject teams and management that can support the overall adaptive management of the programme. In this regard, CMI needs to further develop its internal capacity and culture of cross-learning to make best use of the information gathered via internal process es, especially between the different implementing teams but also between programmatic and support teams. In addition to close cooperation and coordination among all relevant actors, best available analysis and a conducive environment, high quality peacebu ilding work requires sufficient funding from multiple sources. A broad funding base enhances an organisations independence and economic resilience, particularly at times of economic hardship. As CMI works in fragile states and in the sphere of political ch ange. Such volatile environments present risks in terms of weak infrastructure and systems, corruption and safety and security threats. An up-to-date situational picture and portfolio thinking in diversifying risks are key in risk management in complex env ironments.
